content: roll cowl a simple knits design instructions co 100 sts with bulky weight yarn or change co in multiples of 5 sts using a worsted or aran weight yarn co 140-150 sts on a 16 size 8 or 9 knitting needle you ll need 150-200 yards of yarn depending on the size cowl you want join to begin knitting in the round being careful not to twist your cast on all rounds keep repeating k3 p2 around until you only have enough yarn left to bind off all sts or cowl is as long as you desire i saved 6 yards for bobble bobble all sts in ribbing pattern cut yarn pull yarn end out of last stitch and weave in ends the ribbing will relax after washing or knit a fast-and-easy cowl in a 3x2 rib in the round on a steaming both of 16 circular knitting needle using a bulky or super bulky these cowls cid 179 were weight yarn the uneven rib stitch gives a different look knit with the same to the cowl depending on which side of the cowl shows yarn and needle size dress up a coat dress or top with and stay warm too the top cowl has the blue cowl was knit with one skein of lion brand been washed and wool-ease tonal 124 yards with a size 11 8 mm dried the bottom needle bulky and super bulky weight yarn vary a lot in one has not been thickness look for one that works with a size 11 needle washed or use a different needle size for a another weight of yarn change the needle size and the number of stitches cast on for the desired size yarn amounts will vary key co - cast on materials k - knit 124-140 yds of bulky or super bulky yarn bobble - bind off size 11 8 mm 16 circular knitting needle p - purl yarn needle st s - stitch es unblocked gauge 2 5 sts & 4 row = 1 in ribbing finished size © 2018 jamie roe & vicki mikulak all rights reserved 8 tall x 22 around unblocked for personal non-commercial use only 8 tall x 32 around after wash/dry questions simple knits@yahoo com revised 2/28/2020
